author: Zach LaChance
description: President Donald Trump responded to Sen. Rand Paul‘s (R-KY) opposition to the “big, beautiful bill,” warning the senator that if he votes against it, the “GREAT people of Kentucky will never forgive him.” In a Truth Social post on Saturday, Trump said if Paul votes against his megabill, he will only be greenlighting a “68% […]
title: Trump warns Rand Paul against opposition to ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Zach LaChance
description: The White House announced on Saturday that they withdrew Jared Isaacman’s nomination to lead NASA, a move that comes just days before he was set to face a confirmation vote in the Senate. In a statement, White House spokeswoman Liz Huston emphasized that it’s “essential” the next leader of the U.S. space agency is in […]
title: White House withdraws Jared Isaacman’s nomination to lead NASA

author: Jack Birle
description: President Donald Trump’s special envoy to the Middle East Steve Witkoff blasted Hamas‘s response to the proposed ceasefire brokered by the United States in the war in Gaza. Hamas, the terrorist group that sparked the conflict in Gaza with its Oct. 7, 2023, attacks against Israel, said Saturday it had responded to the U.S.-backed ceasefire […]
title: Witkoff blasts Hamas response to ceasefire proposal as ‘totally unacceptable’

author: Jack Birle
description: Gov. Tim Walz (D-MN) called on his fellow Democrats to “be a little meaner” on Saturday as he fuels speculation about a 2028 presidential run during a stop in South Carolina. While some Democrats have called on their party to change its rhetoric as its “toxic” brand sinks its favorability, former Vice President Kamala Harris‘s […]
title: Tim Walz calls on Democrats to ‘be a little meaner’ as party suffers from ‘toxic’ brand

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — The 10 men who escaped from a New Orleans jail more than two weeks ago by cutting out a hole behind a toilet received help from at least 15 people, many of them friends and family who provided food, cash, transport and shelter according to court documents. Records reviewed by the Associated Press […]
title: A growing number of New Orleans fugitives’ friends and family arrested for aiding in jail escape

author: The Associated Press
description: ATLANTA (AP) — Before the oppressive summer heat descends on Atlanta, therapist Brittanee Sims usually gets her thick, curly hair braided at a salon to preserve her healthy mane. But it’s more expensive this year. So she’ll only pay for her teenage daughter and son to get their summer hairdos. Not having braided hair “creates […]
title: The black hair industry imports products from China. Here’s what tariffs mean for braids and wigs

author: The Associated Press
description: The headline-grabbing tale of an Italian man who said he was kidnapped and tortured for weeks inside an upscale Manhattan townhouse by captors seeking his bitcoin highlights a dark corner of the cryptocurrency world: the threat of violence by thieves seeking digital assets. The alleged attempted robbery is known as a “wrench attack.” It’s a name popularized […]
title: Why ‘wrench attacks’ on wealthy crypto holders are on the rise

author: Jack Birle
description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon announced Friday that New York violated civil rights law by banning the use of Native American mascots and logos by schools in the state, threatening to pull federal funding if it does not reverse course. An investigation into the state was opened after the Native American Guardians Association filed a complaint […]
title: Trump administration threatens to pull funding from New York schools over Native American mascot ban

author: The Associated Press
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — With predictions for a busy hurricane season beginning Sunday, experts in storms and disasters are worried about something potentially as chaotic as the swirling winds: Massive cuts to the federal system that forecasts, tracks and responds to hurricanes. Experts are alarmed over the large-scale staff reductions, travel and training restrictions and grant cut-offs since President Donald Trump […]
title: Turmoil, worry swirl over cuts to key federal agencies as hurricane season begins

author: The Associated Press
description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — It wasn’t going to be easy to track down the woman who came to be known as “Miss Atomic Bomb.” All Robert Friedrichs had to go on was a stage name he found printed under an archival newspaper photo that showed her posing with other Las Vegas showgirls. It would take […]
title: Miss Atomic Bomb: The woman, the mystery and the man who solved it

author: Joe Concha
description: The date is Nov. 3, 2026. Democrats are able to erase the GOP’s razor-thin majority in the House to take back the majority, while Republicans hold the Senate, albeit barely.  Immediately after the new Congress is sworn in and Rep. Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY) is made the new speaker of the House, announcements come fast and […]
title: Democrats winning the 2026 midterm elections may be the kiss of death. Here’s why

author: The Associated Press
description: GENEVA (AP) — A small Alpine river dammed by a landslide that largely buried the Swiss village of Blatten is now flowing through the debris, and the level of a newly created lake that raised worries about potential new destruction has fallen, authorities said Saturday. A huge mass of rock, ice and mud from the Birch glacier […]
title: A river dammed by a huge Swiss landslide is flowing again. That’s a relief to authorities

author: Center Square
description: (The Center Square) — U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement is calling on law enforcement officials in all U.S. counties to participate in a federal program, 287(g). Those who do receive free training and resources, potentially federal grant money, and a partnership with the Trump administration to identify violent criminals illegally in the country, many of […]
title: Law enforcement agencies in 40 states are partnering with ICE program

author: Center Square
description: (The Center Square) — A legislative committee has rejected a bipartisan bill to end a loophole in California’s mental health diversion program that allows mentally ill individuals charged with domestic violence, human trafficking or assault of a child under age 8 resulting in the child’s death, to seek mental health treatment instead of facing criminal […]
title: California legislators reject bill closing loophole on violent offenders

author: Jack Birle
description: Ukraine suffered another bombardment of aerial attacks from Russia Friday night into Saturday morning as successful talks toward a peace deal to end the war appear far from happening. There were 114 aerial attacks on Ukraine via drones and missiles overnight, with at least 10 people being killed and 33 others injured due to the […]
title: Russia bombards Ukraine overnight as Trump’s patience with Putin wears thin

author: Jack Birle
description: The Federal Aviation Administration said on Friday that it will require SpaceX to conduct a mishap investigation after the failed test flight of Starship Flight 9 earlier this week. SpaceX’s Starship broke up upon reentry during its Tuesday test flight, after a fuel leak caused it to lose control of its altitude. The FAA said […]
title: FAA demands investigation into SpaceX Starship test failure

author: Jack Birle
description: A federal appeals court on Friday opted to keep in place a lower court’s decision to block the Trump administration‘s sweeping federal workforce cuts under the Department of Government Efficiency. The three-judge panel on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit ruled 2-1 to deny the Trump administration’s bid to stay the earlier […]
title: Appeals court keeps block on DOGE federal workforce cuts

author: Paul Bedard
description: As President Donald Trump enters just his 132nd day in office on Saturday, our White House Report Card finds him in a good position. The courts gave him wins on his tariff and immigration policy, inflation surprised by ticking down, he heralded a series of DOGE victories in bidding Elon Musk farewell, and he’s getting […]
title: Trump wins on tariffs, immigration, inflation: White House Report Card

author: Salena Zito
description: WEST MIFFLIN, Pennsylvania — Flanked by a sea of steelworkers dressed in their orange safety jackets and hard hats, President Donald Trump was given a hero’s welcome at the Mon Valley Irvin Works to mark the signing of the U.S. Steel-Nippon Steel deal, the largest investment in state history. “With the help from patriots like […]
title: Trump returns Pennsylvania steel to the backbone of America

author: Byron York
description: LOOKING BACK ON MUSK AND DOGE. Elon Musk officially said goodbye to DOGE and government service in an Oval Office session with President Donald Trump and reporters on Friday afternoon. But after one of the most talked-about initiatives in executive branch history, there wasn’t that much to talk about. Even though Musk’s limited-by-law 130 days as a […]
title: Looking back on Musk and DOGE

author: Robert Schmad
description: “If I can’t spend it on me,” President Donald Trump told a gathering of Republican governors in February, “I guess it means I’m going to be spending it on some of my friends.” The president was referencing the more than $600 million spread across his network of political groups that he has raised and reportedly […]
title: Campaign finance data paint favorable picture for Republicans, with a few snags

author: Elisha Krauss
description: When my governor started a podcast, I was aghast. In fact, social media went wild with frustrations regarding his lack of self-awareness and overflow of narcissism and self-promotion. As it turns out, Gavin Newsom (D-CA) is still bad for girls, women, California, and the country. Take it from me, a 12-year resident of the state he’s governed […]
title: Gavin Newsom is a wolf in centrists’ clothing

author: Harry Khachatrian
description: Craig Mazin might be the most libertarian showrunner working in television today. Chernobyl, his breakout miniseries, was a harrowing indictment of centralized incompetence. And The Last of Us, at least in its first season, revolved around the corrupting perils of consolidated power, culminating in one man’s decision to protect a child rather than submit to the demands […]
title: ‘The Last of Us,’ Season 2: The apocalypse and teenage melodrama

author: Christian Datoc
description: On Friday, President Donald Trump traveled to West Mifflin, Pennsylvania, to deliver remarks commemorating a merger between U.S. Steel and Japan’s Nippon Steel. Trump’s speech carried a markedly different tone from comments he made last year about Nippon’s bid to acquire the Pittsburgh-based steel conglomerate. “As president, I will block this deal from happening,” he […]
title: Three issues on which Trump has done a total 180 compared to his first term

author: Elizabeth Stauffer
description: President Donald Trump‘s arrival on the political scene 10 years ago has served to radicalize Democrats into an extraordinary level of derangement. We’ve had the Russian collusion hoax and two baseless impeachments. We’ve had coordinated efforts with the media and Big Tech to suppress reporting on former President Joe Biden’s involvement in his family’s foreign […]
title: Can Democrats rebuild public trust after a decade of lies?

author: Lauren Green
description: Many industries continue to look forward with uncertainty as the future of President Donald Trump’s tariffs remains unknown, leading influencers to wonder what comes next. Market volatility has enraged Democrats and worried many Republicans as the country experiences whiplash from tariff announcements, leaving many people worried about their finances. The market volatility seen this year […]
title: Fast fashion could take a hit from Trump’s tariffs, hurting influencers livelihood

author: John Roberts
description: President Donald Trump’s statement about the COVID-19 lab leak at the Wuhan Institute of Virology and the report of the Select Committee on the Coronavirus Pandemic have revealed COVID-19’s origin and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and National Institutes of Health’s culpability for fostering and then mishandling the pandemic.  Calls for accountability have […]
title: The COVID-19 reckoning starts with you

author: Haisten Willis
description: Many people first heard the term “autopen” when President Donald Trump accused his predecessor of using it illicitly earlier this spring. “The ‘Pardons’ that Sleepy Joe Biden gave to the Unselect Committee of Political Thugs, and many others, are hereby declared VOID, VACANT, AND OF NO FURTHER FORCE OR EFFECT, because of the fact that […]
title: The long history and controversy of presidential autopen use

author: Mia Cathell
description: Diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives at the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) are still discriminating against white farmers despite a change in administration and the threat of litigation, a civil rights watchdog told the Washington Examiner, amid new whistleblower allegations accusing the agency of offering race-based loan relief under former President Joe Biden. The Wisconsin […]
title: USDA still discriminating against white farmers, watchdog says

author: Timothy Nerozzi
description: France is on track to become the latest European nation to legalize assisted suicide for adults suffering from severe maladies, but not without opposition. The National Assembly voted on Tuesday to establish a “right to assistance in dying” for adults who are “afflicted with a serious illness” and have requested euthanasia. Under the framework of […]
title: France becomes latest Western battleground for assisted suicide

author: Washington Examiner
description: President Donald Trump is finally losing patience with Russian President Vladimir Putin‘s disdain for honorable efforts to end the war in Ukraine. On Memorial Day, Trump responded to a weekend of extreme Russian attacks on cities across Ukraine by threatening new sanctions. He said Putin had “gone absolutely crazy.” On May 27, he added a […]
title: The president must compel Putin to move toward peace

author: Brady Knox
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth described Israel, Poland, and the Gulf and Baltic states as “model allies” of the United States, a remark sure to raise eyebrows over others who may consider themselves close allies. Speaking in Singapore as part of the Shangri-La Dialogue 2025, hosted by the International Institute for Strategic Studies, Hegseth once again […]
title: Pete Hegseth praises Israel, Poland, Gulf and Baltic states as ‘model allies’

author: Brady Knox
description: Gov. Wes Moore (D-MA) heaped praise on Democratic kingmaker Rep. Jim Clyburn (D-SC) at a high-profile South Carolina dinner. Moore insists he has no intentions to run for president in 2028, but his appearance at the dinner is sure to add to speculation. As the keynote speaker at the Democrats’ 2025 Blue Palmetto Dinner at […]
title: Wes Moore pays tribute to Democratic kingmaker James Clyburn – as he insists he’s not running in 2028

author: Brady Knox
description: PBS sued the Trump administration on Friday over the president’s move to defund public media. In an executive order signed May 1, President Donald Trump ordered the Corporation for Public Broadcasting to “cancel existing direct funding to the maximum extent allowed by law and shall decline to provide future funding” to NPR and PBS, arguing […]
title: PBS sues Trump administration for defunding the network

author: Marisa Schultz and Ramsey Touchberry
description: EXCLUSIVE — Rep. Bill Huizenga (R-MI) showed no signs of backing down from exploring a run for Michigan’s open Senate seat in an interview Friday with the Washington Examiner, even as his potential entry is frustrating national Republicans who’ve already coalesced around former Rep. Mike Rogers. President Donald Trump, who endorsed Rogers in his unsuccessful […]
title: Bill Huizenga readies Michigan Senate bid that could upend the GOP’s primary plans

author: Brady Knox
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is delivering a speech in Singapore. His address comes as part of the Shangri-La Dialogue 2025, hosted by the International Institute for Strategic Studies. He’s set to begin his speech at around 8:30 p.m. DEFENSE DEPARTMENT SCRAPS WEEKLY DOGE-INITIATED ACTIVITY REPORTS The Department of Defense said Hegseth will discuss the agency’s […]
title: WATCH LIVE: Hegseth delivers speech in Singapore
